intro: Polymnia macvaughii, commonly known as the MacVaugh's polymnia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers with five petals. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands. Polymnia macvaughii is considered a rare species and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
